fields.headline: Karlovic moves into comfort zone
fields.bodyText: Ivo Karlovic celebrated his transformation from nobody to superstar yesterday by transferring from his £25-per-night lodgings in Earls Court to a five-star hotel in Kensington. The Croatian, who beat Lleyton Hewitt on Monday, can expect to improve significantly on the £14,000 prize money he is guaranteed even if he is ejected from the competition today by the Australian Paul Baccanello. He spent yesterday afternoon on the court with a reporter from a mid-market tabloid - although sources at the newspaper insisted no money had changed hands. An International Tennis Federation employee who speaks Serbo-Croat is at present negotiating sponsorship opportunities for the world No203, who previously represented himself but will be a centre of attention for as long as he stays in the tournament. Karlovic played his first-round match wearing a patch advertising Geico, a US insurance company, but that was simply a one-off deal struck as soon as he realised he would be up against Hewitt.
